IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE MISSION OF THE ELKHART COUNTY COMMUNITY FOUNDATION (ECCF) IS TO INSPIRE PEOPLE TO MAKE CHARITABLE GIFTS THAT IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN ELKHART COUNTY.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE MISSION OF THE ELKHART COUNTY COMMUNITY FOUNDATION (ECCF) IS TO INSPIRE PEOPLE TO MAKE CHARITABLE GIFTS THAT IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN ELKHART COUNTY.
IRS990.Description: THE ELKHART COUNTY COMMUNITY FOUNDATION (ECCF) SUPPORTS NEW AND EXISTING PROGRAMS OF NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS FOR SPECIFIC CHARITABLE PURPOSES. ITS DONATIONS ARE RECEIVED FROM PRIVATE AND PUBLIC ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS. AS A PUBLIC, TAX-EXEMPT, PHILANTHROPIC ORGANIZATION, CREATED BY AND FOR ALL THE PEOPLE OF THE COUNTY, WE SOLICIT AND DEVELOP ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND DISTRIBUTE INCOME FROM THEM FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY. WE DO SO WITH ENTHUSIASM, DEDICATION AND SINCERE PASSION, BECAUSE ECCF IS THE PHILANTHROPIC CONDUIT IN ELKHART COUNTY. HUNDREDS OF DONORS WHO CARE DEEPLY ABOUT THIS COUNTY LOOK TO US BECAUSE OF OUR STRONG COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS, OUR DEPTH OF KNOWLEDGE AND OUR ABILITY TO PUT THEIR CONTRIBUTIONS TO WORK, PROVIDING SOLUTIONS THAT CAN MAKE DRAMATIC, LIFE-ALTERING CHANGE POSSIBLE FOR ELKHART COUNTY CHILDREN AND ADULTS IN NEED. ECCF ADMINISTERS MORE THAN 200 FUNDS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BEQUEATHED BY INDIVIDUALS, OTHER AGENCIES, CORPORATIONS, AND FOUNDATIONS.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: OTHER INCOME, SCHEDULE A, PART II, SECTION B, LINE 10, OTHER INCOME RECEIVED IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE: 2005 - $0 2006 - $0 2007 - $17,499 2008 - $0 2009 - $6,236,

OtherLiabilities.Description: FUNDS HELD FOR BENEFIT OF OTHERS

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE INTENDED USE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS TO PROVIDE FUNDS TO BENEFIT NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN ELKHART COUNTY.

THE ELKHART COUNTY COMMUNITY FOUNDATION, INC. IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND IS NOT CONSIDERED TO BE A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION HAS BEEN MADE FOR FEDERAL INCOME TAXES. THE FOUNDATION FOLLOWS U.S. GAAP WITH RESPECT TO ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES AS OF JULY 1, 2009. A TAX POSITION IS RECOGNIZED AS A BENEFIT ONLY IF IT IS "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" THAT THE TAX POSITION WOULD BE SUSTAINED IN A TAX EXAMINATION, WITH A TAX EXAMINATION BEING PRESUMED TO OCCUR. THE AMOUNT RECOGNIZED IS THE LARGEST AMOUNT OF TAX BENEFIT THAT IS GREATER THAN 50% LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED ON EXAMINATION. FOR TAX POSITIONS NOT MEETING THE "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" TEST, NO TAX BENEFIT IS RECORDED. THE ADOPTION HAD NO AFFECT ON THE FOUNDATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. DUE TO ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS, THE FOUNDATION IS NOT GENERALLY SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL INCOME TAX OR STATE INCOME TAX. THE FOUNDATION'S FORM 990 HAS NOT BEEN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE FOR THE LAST THREE YEARS. THE FOUNDATION DOES NOT EXPECT THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS TO SIGNIFICANTLY CHANGE IN THE NEXT 12 MONTHS. THE FOUNDATION RECOGNIZES INTEREST AND/OR PENALTIES RELATED TO INCOME TAX MATTERS IN INCOME TAX EXPENSE. THE FOUNDATION DID NOT HAVE ANY AMOUNTS ACCRUED FOR INTEREST AND PENALTIES AT JUNE 30, 2010.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF CHARITABLE REMAINDER TRUST - 3534; OTHER - 0; TOTAL - 3534

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GRANTS COMMITTEE REVIEWS GRANT APPLICATIONS EACH QUARTER AND GIVES A RECOMMENDATION AS TO WHICH ORGANIZATIONS WILL RECEIVE A GRANT, AS WELL AS HOW MUCH MONEY EACH ORGANIZATION WILL RECEIVE. THE GRANTS COMMITTEE'S RECOMMENDATIONS ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. OTHER GRANTS REQUESTS FROM DESIGNATED, DONOR ADVISED, AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE APPROVED BY THE PROGRAM OFFICER AND THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. ORGANIZATIONS THAT RECEIVE GRANTS FROM UNRESTRICTED FUNDS HAVE UP TO ONE YEAR TO REPORT BACK TO ECCF REGARDING HOW THE GRANT FUNDS WERE USED. GRANTS FROM DONOR ADVISED AND DESIGNATED FUNDS ARE UNRESTRICTED AND CAN BE USED IN ANY WAY THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS WOULD LIKE .

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Review of form 990 by governing body
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT, FINANCIAL MANAGER, AND TREASURER REVIEW THE FORM 990 IN DETAIL. AFTER ANY QUESTIONS HAVE BEEN ANSWERED AND ANY CHANGES HAVE BEEN MADE, THE FORM 990 IS PRESENTED OT THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS AT A QUARTERLY BOARD MEETING BY OUR TAX ADVISORS. ONCE APPROVED BY THE BOARD, THE RETURN IS THEN FILED WITH THE IRS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALL BOARD MEMBERS, COMMITTEE MEMBERS AND ALL EMPLOYEES COMPLETE AN ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE. THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT REVIEWS THE COMPLETED QUESTIONNAIRES TO DETERMINE IF ANY POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST EXIST. IF THERE IS A CONFLICT, THE COMMITTEE HEAD WILL ADDRESS IT WITH THE PERSON AND POSSIBLY ASK THEM TO REMOVE THEMSELVES FROM SAID COMMITTEE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, TRUSTEES, KEY EMPLOYEES, AND HIGHEST COMPENSATED EMPLOYEES
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: W. EARL TAYLOR, PRESIDENT/CEO, DEVOTES APPROXIMATELY ONE HOUR PER WEEK TO DREAMSWORK, INC. AND WELLFIELD BOTANIC GARDENS, INC., RELATED TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS. ELIZABETH NAQUIN-BORGER, DIRECTOR, DEVOTES APPROXIMATELY ONE HOUR PER WEEK TO WELLFIELD BOTANIC GARDENS, INC,, A RELATED TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION. THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUALS DEVOTE APPROXIMATELY ONE HOUR PER WEEK TO ECCF HOLDINGS, INC., A RELATED TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION: BRIAN SMITH, SECRETARY MATT PLETCHER, TREASURER MICHAEL PIANOWSKI, CHAIRMAN REBECCA BALL-MILLER, VICE CHAIRMAN MICHAEL KUBACKI, DIRECTOR ANDREW FRECH, DIRECTOR

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PROCESS USED TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION FOR TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIAL
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE UTILIZES THE NATIONAL COUNCIL ON FOUNDATIONS ANNUAL SURVEY TO DETERMINE THE APPROPRIATE AMOUNT OF COMPENSATION. THE PRESIDENT WAS LAST EVALUATED IN LATE 2009, AND THE EVALUATION FORMS ARE KEPT ON FILE BY THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PROCESS USED TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION FOR OTHER OFFICERS
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION FOR ALL EMPLOYEES (INCLUDING OTHER OFFICERS) ANNUALLY AND DETERMINES THE AMOUNT OF ANY PAY INCREASES TO BE GIVEN. THE PRESIDENT UTILIZES THE NATIONAL COUNCIL ON FOUNDATION'S ANNUAL SURVEY TO DETERMINE THE APROPRIATE AMOUNT OF COMPENSATION. THE FINANCIAL MANAGER POSITION WAS CHANGED TO FULL-TIME IN AUGUST OF 2008 AND A PAY INCREASE WAS GIVEN AT THAT TIME; COMPENSATION WAS ALSO REVIEWED IN 2009 AND NO PAY INCREASE WAS GIVEN AT THIS TIME.
